intro: Didissandra evrardii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has a woody stem and produces oval, yellowish fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in savanna regions. Due to its unique appearance and medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and herbalists alike.
